title: Potentia's Ascender hires adviser for $500m-plus float
text:
Payroll and HR software company Ascender has hired an independent adviser ahead of a mooted $500 million-plus ASX listing.

Street Talk understands Evans Dixon Corporate Advisory has been tapped to oversee an initial public offering that could see the private equity-backed Ascender raise about $250 million for a market value of as much as $750 million.

Fund managers will likely compare ASX aspirant Ascender to the likes of education and employment sector name ReadyTech which is trading at 6.5-times historical revenue. James Alcock

An independent adviser is drafted in by the issuer to help project manage the offer process, including overseeing the appointment of investment banks.

Evans Dixon will fulfil that role at Ascender. The company is expected to be pitched as a major player in the local payroll software sector, with more than $100 million a year revenue and strong growth since Andrew Gray's Potentia Capital took control in 2015.

It comes after this column revealed Potentia had sent a request for proposal for Ascender to a handful of bulge bracket investment banks late last week, inviting them to pitch for sell-side roles.
description: Payroll and HR software company Ascender has hired an independent adviser ahead of a mooted ASX listing.
